Package model

Class Model

java.lang.Object
model.Model
public class Model extends Object
The Model class represents the game logic and state of the Battleship game. It contains methods for generating ships, checking the suitability of coordinates for ship placement, randomly placing ships, receiving shots, updating colors, tracking ship counts, and updating health status. The model interacts with the controller to handle user input and update the view. The model is responsible for maintaining the game state and providing methods to manipulate the state and perform game-related operations. The model uses the PlayerBoard and ComputerBoard classes to represent the game boards and ships. The model also defines colors and uses the miscellaneous class to store various constants.
Author:
Gia Bao Tran - Kiet Tran

  • Method Details

    • generateShip

      public void generateShip(Board board)
      Generates ships for the specified board based on the dimension.
      Parameters:
      board - the Board object to generate ships for

    • isSuitableForShip

      public boolean isSuitableForShip(Board board, Ship ship, int row, int col)
      Checks if the specified range of coordinates is suitable for placing a ship of the given length.
      Parameters:
      board - the board on which the ship is being placed
      row - the row index of the starting coordinate
      col - the column index of the starting coordinate
      length - the length of the ship
      isHorizontal - true if the ship should be placed horizontally, false if vertically
      Returns:
      true if the range is suitable for placing a ship of the given length, false otherwise

    • randomizeShip

      public void randomizeShip(Board board)
      Randomly places the ships on the board.
      Parameters:
      board - the Board object representing the game board

    • randomizeShips

      public void randomizeShips()
      Randomly places the ships on both the computer and player boards.

    • setShip

      public void setShip(Board board, Ship ship, int randRow, int randCol)
      Sets the ships on the board based on the specified starting coordinate and orientation.
      Parameters:
      board - the Board object on which to set the ships
      ship - the Ship object to set
      randRow - the row index of the starting coordinate
      randCol - the column index of the starting coordinate
      horizontal - true if the ship should be placed horizontally, false if vertically

    • receiveShot

      public boolean receiveShot(Board board, Coordinate coordinate)
      Receives a shot on the specified board at the given coordinate.
      Parameters:
      board - the Board object to receive the shot on
      coordinate - the Coordinate object representing the shot coordinate
      Returns:
      true if the shot hits a ship, false otherwise

    • enterDesignMode

      public void enterDesignMode()
      Enters the design mode for the player board. Creates a new player board, generates ships, and initializes the ship count and current ship.

    • endDesignMode

      public void endDesignMode()
      Ends the design mode for the player board. Updates the health of the player board and ends the design mode on the board.

    • canPlay

      public boolean canPlay()
      Returns:
      a boolean indicating the game can start or continue or not
